job.title: Micro Lab Technician - Manufacturing (34486)
job.description:
Micro Lab Technician - Manufacturing
W2 Contract - 12 Months 
Onsite- Ada, Michigan

* This is a first shift position. Start time can vary from 7:00-8:30 with end time of 3:30-5 depending on start time selected. Manufacturing environment experience is highly preferred, but not required.*

Clover Consulting (a Myticas Co.) is seeking a Micro Lab Technician for a large direct client in the Grand Rapids metro area.  This is a 12 month, W2 contract with possible extensions for upwards of three years.

This is an entry-level position within the Research & Development Analytical Laboratory. This role provides critical laboratory support for analytical testing and experimentation that contribute to product innovation, method development, and technical research initiatives across multiple product platforms.

This first-shift position is part of a collaborative laboratory team focused on generating high-quality experimental data and maintaining an organized, well-functioning lab environment. You will be trained on a variety of analytical techniques, instrumentation, and data recording systems commonly used in R&D environments.

Daily responsibilities may include preparation of media and reagents, cleaning and sterilizing glassware and laboratory equipment, maintaining laboratory supplies and inventory, supporting sample preparation and basic analytical testing, calibrating instruments, and ensuring proper documentation of laboratory activities.

Skills to be successful in the role:
  • Flexible team player
  • Attention to detail
  • Ability to communicate and elevate issues to leadership
  • Ability to sit, stand, and lift up to 50lbs
  • GMP microbiology laboratory experience preferred
Required qualifications:
  • Laboratory experience (in education or industry)
  • Demonstrated ability to follow SOPs/test methods
Education: 2 years of college in a science related field and/or demonstrated experience in microbiology laboratory procedures

  • Regular meeting practices are maintained and agreed actions are driven to completion
  • Contract might be defined as key project by Business Group (BG) / market. Delivers the operational and project single/multiple BG / Business Units (BU) scope to the customer.
  • Ensures all project and operational management is in full alignment with our clients Mode of Operation (MoO), BG / Business Line (BL) guidelines and the PM methodology.
  • Plans customer projects and keeps plan updated to reflect and anticipate changes by coordinating change management on all aspects affecting cost, scope, schedule and quality (CSSQ).
  • Assures consistency among project financials, product and service forecast activities.
  • Participates in pre-sales and sales process activities.
  • Determines delivery approach alternatives and manages the selection of the final recommended approach to delivery.
  • Ensures hand over from Sell to Execute and from Delivery to Care is done and monitors progress against it.
  • Ensures project contract management process is initiated and executed.
  • Defines the customization of any global operational processes together with relevant points of contact to meet project requirements (for example, network operations, supply chain, logistics, and acceptance).
  • Manages the customer relationship during delivery and serves as the primary interface towards the customer in all activities related to the own scope of the contract, including customer complaints, corrective actions, and changing requirements.
  • Prepares a clear and effective communications plan and ensures proactive communication of all relevant information to the customer and to all stakeholders.
  • Monitors and controls that the project is delivered within the approved budget, profitability forecast, and planned scope.
  • Ensures that the project meets all objectives for quality and looks continuously for quality improvement and customer satisfaction.
  • Actively applies appropriate best practices and lessons learned throughout the life of the project. Monitors, controls and reports KPIs defined in customer contract.
  • Ensures data in all project-related tools and repositories is kept up-to-date and of high quality.
  • Conducts thorough risk management for all project risks and opportunities.
  • Seeks to define new opportunities to expand and renew contracts with the customer.
  • Leads the project team and may perform some line manager responsibilities.
  • Completes the project closure and / or handover as required (for example, complete contractual requirements, post calculation, lessons learned). (The term, customer project, refers to all forms of customer contracts, projects with a definitive start and end, and programs as collections of projects managed together for business benefits which may contain an ongoing operations business)
  • Minimum 5 years of Microwave
  • Great interpersonal skills a must

job.title: Structural Engineering Discipline Specialist (34478)
job.description:
Structural Engineering Discipline Specialist – Direct Hire
Location: Indianapolis, IN
Pay Range: $62.50 - $69.70 per hour
Benefits: Access to full portfolio of client benefits

Responsibilities
 
  • Provide discipline leadership for the structural design and documentation of various sizes and scopes of projects.
  • Support the Department Manager by providing leadership for the Structural discipline components, ensuring at a high level, that the delivery of the Structural Design and Engineering deliverables meet quality expectations and schedules.
  • Provide technical guidance and oversight to less experienced personnel as necessary including encouraging and mentoring with their career advancement.
  • Assist management with structural staff forecasting to balance the number of resources with the amount of work. This may include increasing staff, loaning to and/or borrowing from other offices, or shifting work between offices.
  • Assist in the evaluation and employee performance feedback
  • Assist in project proposals by ascertaining scope, determining the required engineering/design budgets
  • Maintain effective communications with department members, higher management, and with clients.
  • Promote the global data centric tool initiative and assist the team in growing technical competency

Qualifications
 
  • Bachelors or Masters of Science in Civil/Structuring Engineering
  • Professional Engineering (P.E.) License
  • Minimum 12+ years of experience in engineering design of building structural systems for pharmaceutical/industrial/chemical facilities.
  • Must have demonstrated experience in leading the structural design for steel and concrete structures on a variety of projects sizes and execution approaches.
  • Must have advanced working proficiency in STAAD and STAAD Pro
  • Must have working knowledge of AutoCAD, Revit, and Navis.
  • Must have a solid working knowledge of building codes and other applicable structural codes.
  • Must have previous leadership and mentoring experience for structural engineers and designers
  • Should have and display strong communication skills both verbal and written.

job.title: Office Manager (34553)
job.description:
Office Manager

Location: Silver Springs, MD
Salary: $70,000 – $75,000
Schedule: In-office, Monday – Friday

About the Role:
We’re looking for an organized, detail-oriented Office Manager to support our project and operations teams. You’ll help keep projects on track by managing documentation, vendor approvals, daily reports, and other office operations. If you’re proactive, tech-savvy, and enjoy working in a collaborative environment, this role is for you!

Key Responsibilities:

  • Organize and maintain project files and daily reports

  • Answer phones, route mail, and support general office operations

What We’re Looking For:

  • Proven office management or project coordination experience

  • Strong proficiency in Excel, Word, and Outlook

  • Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail & professional demeanor.

  • Effective verbal and written communication

  • Ability to multi-task, prioritize, and meet deadlines

  • High School Diploma required; Associate’s or Bachelor’s preferred

Why You’ll Love This Role:

  • Opportunity to work closely with project teams and gain hands-on experience in project operations

  • Competitive salary and supportive work environment

job.title: SAP Technical Analyst (PPDS, EWM, TM) (34547)
job.description:
Clover Consulting has a direct client in Grand Rapids, MI in need of an SAP Technical Analyst (PPDS, EWM, TM) for a 12++ month contract with the potential for hire.  This is an On-Site role in Grand Rapids, MI.  The skills required are below:

12 Months
$80/hr BR

SAP Technical Analyst - onsite in Grand Rapids, MI full time 

Technical Analyst
We are looking for a technical analyst with primarily SAP S/4 experience to contribute to the objectives of our global team and its ongoing projects. In this role, you will apply Agile methodologies to facilitate the efficient delivery of robust SAP S/4 technical solutions that advance cross-functional business strategies and initiatives.
 
The team you will be part of    
 
We are a global team managing the migration from SAP ECC to S/4 to support manufacturing, distribution, and logistics. Our versatile members ensure smooth transition and ongoing ECC technical support, working collaboratively to achieve team objectives and align with company goals.
 
Primary Responsibilities
 
As a technical analyst, your responsibilities will include:
·         Interpreting functional specifications and translating them into implementable and supportable technical solutions
·         Developing technical specifications utilizing standardized templates
·         Creating and maintaining comprehensive technical documentation
·         Conducting research on S/4 platform best practices to address business process requirements
·         Collaborating with technical developers to ensure deliverables meet business requirements and expectations
·         Unit testing developed solutions
·         Troubleshooting business and technical processes on platforms such as SAP ECC, S/4, and .Net
·         Applying minor ABAP code enhancements and SAP configuration
·         Applying Agile methodologies and principles throughout the entire development lifecycle
·         Maintaining up-to-date knowledge of emerging technologies and proactively sharing innovative ideas for process improvement
·         Providing support for end-user requests or issues through the incident reporting tool, ServiceNow
 
Knowledge and Skills
·         Experience in SAP S/4
·         Experience in SAP S/4 modules PPDS, EWM, and/or TM
·         Experience in maintaining SAP system configuration (SPRO)
·         Experience in SAP ECC a plus
·         Experience with Agile methodologies and concepts
·         Experience in debugging transactions, ABAP programs, and function modules
·         Experience in writing ABAP code a plus
·         Experience with Microsoft Office Suite, including Word, Excel, Visio, and PowerPoint
·         Knowledgeable in all aspects of ABAP development, including reports, enhancements, interfaces, function modules, workflows, and classes
·         Knowledgeable in Fiori, SAPUI5, CDS views, OData technologies, APIs, Cloud Platform, HANA DB, and implementing or extending standard SAP Fiori applications
·         Knowledgeable in BADIs, enhancement points, BAPIs, IDOCs, and Web Services
·         Knowledgeable in Discreet Manufacturing a plus
·         Knowledgeable in Make to Order (MTO) a plus
·         Knowledgeable in manufacturing BOMs and Routings a plus
·         Knowledgeable with Azure DevOps (ADO) a plus
 
Who you are
 
·         Build strong relationships and communicate clearly and effectively with diverse team members
·         Demonstrate a strong work ethic, share knowledge, achieve goals, and meet deadlines
·         Apply solid problem-solving and analytical abilities
·         Adaptable, as team members must work in modules/areas of S/4 and ECC that they are not familiar with
·         Facilitate data-driven discussions and decisions
·         Support projects that enhance business capabilities
·         Tackle complex system challenges with intuitive thinking
·         Stay updated on system methods, emerging technologies, and best practices
·         Focus on serving the team, customers, IT, and Steelcase
·         Collaborate with cross-functional, global teams
·         Lead and teach others empathetically

job.title: Field Inspection Technician (34548)
job.description:
Field Inspection Technician
Location: Centennial, CO (On-site)

Benefits: Standard Medical, Dental and 401(k) 
Pay Range: $25.00 /hr. - $32.50 /hr.

Responsibilities:
  • Oversee and coordinate utility pre-construction, construction and maintenance projects and other utility-related work or operations occurring within public rights-of-way.
  • Inspect and evaluate right-of-way work in progress to ensure repairs, maintenance, and project activities are performed in accordance with city standards and specifications, as applicable.
  • Provide and update within a computerized maintenance management system (CMMS) (ex. City Works) information for right-of-way permits, such as project status and construction/warranty inspection notes.
  • Schedule and attend pre-construction meetings.
  • Respond to utility emergencies or other situations affecting the public rights-of-way, assess situation and coordinate appropriate response with the CIP Street Rehabilitation Manager.
  • Monitor work sites to ensure adherence to safe work practices and procedures.
  • Follow safety procedures, report unsafe activities and conditions, utilize safety equipment, and monitor work environment to ensure safety of employees and other individuals.
  • Maintain a comprehensive, current knowledge of applicable policies, procedures, codes, regulations.
  • Receive, prepare or complete various forms, reports, correspondence, or other documents.
  • Effectively communicate with management, employees, other departments, the public, contractors and other individuals as needed to coordinate work activities, review status of work, exchange information, or resolve problems; respond to requests for service or assistance.
  • Participate in the development of goals and objectives as well as policies and procedures; make recommendations for changes and improvements to existing standards.
  • Performs general maintenance tasks, such as scheduled vehicle safety inspections, vehicle cleaning, general upkeep, etc., to keep vehicles and assigned equipment in operable condition.
  • Performs other duties as assigned.

Qualifications:
  • High School Diploma or GED.
  • Two years of experience working with public and/or private utilities, with a working knowledge of public-sector right-of-way regulations, construction plans.
  • Working knowledge of Microsoft Office applications, including Excel, PowerPoint, Word, and Outlook, and the ability to operate other standard office equipment; ability to document project status and updates as required in a CMMS, and ability to acquire proficiency level in a CMMS to perform responsibilities.
  • Ability to understand ROW regulations, construction material control and job specifications.
  • Strong inter-personal relationship skills, and verbal and written communications skills.
  • Must possess and maintain a valid Colorado driver’s license.
  • Must be capable of personally driving a company vehicle in the performance of the duties contained herein.



We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other legally protected status. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to any of these characteristics.
